titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. VI. Mrs Adams, with George, Mary Hellen, Elizabeth and Joseph Abbot left Quincy—for Washington— Charles with Shaw in Stage to Boston and to Cambridge— John with me—through Boston to Cambridge Conversation with Prest. Kirkland— Dined with R. G. Amory at Roxbury— Back to Quincy at Eve— Rain— Dark.

2. V:30— Training— Chaise for Stage to Boston— Lieutt. Stockton his report— Genl. Dearborn and Wingate— E. Cruft— Stage Seat. Dined at Jos. Halls— N. Amory—came with H. Welsh to Quincy. De Grands call—training hubbub— J. Marston, his application. Quincy here—

3. V:30. Made up last packages for Washington— Letter to D. Brent. Settlement with my brother, unfinished— Packed a Chest— Lieutt. Stockton, and G. Blake came to dinner— To Boston 5. P.M. Marlborough Hotel. Post-Office. Athenaeum— Spurr’s— W. Sullivan’s Office— Hilliard’s— Mrs Jenks’s— Dr Welsh, L. Walter, Mackay, W. Taggard, and De Grand— Comee. with address to P.U.S. De Grand and Davis— Athenaeum— Proposals to Suffolk Bar—with De Grand. Marlborough Hotel, till 11. P.M.

4. II.15— Left Marlborough Hotel, Boston, before three— 13. in the Stage Andrew Hall, wife & Child—and others— Breakfasted at Polley’s. Walpole— Spoke to Fuller— Mrs A there Monday Night— Chapotin’s Providence. Mrs. Colman— Took up Newman in the Stage— Dined at Greenwich— New-Road— Met W. King— Washington unhealthy— Stonington— Miner’s— Mrs. A. there last Night— New-London at 9. P.M. Found my family there, at Shepherd’s. Coachman ill in bed— H. Channing.

5. VI:30. Left Coachman and Elizabeth— Lanman. Greene— Perkins &c. Steamboat Enterprize, Bunker at 8 A.M— Howard of Savannah &c—reached New-Haven at 3. P.M— Walk to the burying ground— Sherman, Dwight, Styles. Humphrey’s &c— S. Broome— Back to Steam-boat Connecticut, Bunker senr— Enterprize just gone—took off part of our baggage. Letter to Bunker. Evening rough S.S.W. wind— Russ— Ladies Sea Sick.

6. V:30. New-York. City Hotel to Breakfast. Mr & Mrs Sturges— M’Cormick’s— Brodie. Met Mrs De Wint, with C. Clarkson—&c— W. Lewis, Captn. Reed— Steam-Boat Bellona— Vanderbilt from Powles Hoek to Brunswick. dinner Stages 28 Miles to Trenton— 9. P.M— Don Juan— Cantos 3.4–5.

7. V: Stage 3 Miles. Steam-boat Philadelphia Jenkins, to Philadelphia— Miss Shinn’s. 110. South third Street— At Ewing’s— Sick family. Dinner at Miss Shinn’s. Again at Ewing’s— Church at Dr Wilson’s. Haggai 1.5. or 7. Walk with J. Sergeant. Mr Chew— Call at C. J. Ingersoll’s—and Jos. R. Ingersoll’s—walk with C. J. I. Ghent Treaty— Mississippi and Fisheries— Home at 9. P.M.

8. VI:30. J. Connell here— G. Rundle— Clerk of Schuylkill permanent Bridge. absent— Nicholls at Breakfast— J. Vaughan— Garnett and Corbin. at J. Sergeant’s— Come. Murray’s funeral— At Ewing’s— Dr Chapman at J. R. Ingersoll’s— His father; came in— Left papers with him— Dined at Sergeant’s— T. Sergeant there— Walsh and Cadwalader— Reed— Eve at J. Vaughan’s. Patterson— Robertson— Garnett— Harris there— Vaughan came home with me.

9. VI:30. Call at Walsh’s— Ewing’s— Athenaeum— Brown of Louisiana, Duponceau. Saw Walsh at his Office— Cadwalader— Connell— Steam-Boat Baltimore to Newcastle— Roy of Virginia— Stages 7. to Frenchtown— Steam-Boat U.S. Trippe— 75 passengers.

10. Baltimore at 1. A.M— Noisy Boat. At 4. went to Barnum’s—to bed— Stage at half past 5. Breakfast at Merrill’s Waterloo— Jaffray— Washington at 11:30. Family well— At the Office— Many despatches— Frye here at eve— Pitt’s Life
11. V— Diary resumed. Dr Thornton here— At the Office, B. O. Tyler, E. Wyer, W. Taylor and Calhoun— Wirt called— Letter to Mrs A. Philadelphia. Eve at Calhoun’s— Early there.
12. VI:30 Rainy day—wasted at the Office, reading Letter from George at New-Brunswick—despatches from J. B. Prevost—from Jer. Robinson— Evening call at Dr Thornton’s. W. Jones— Life of Pitt.
13. VI:15— T. Cook— J. Bailey. Govr. Cass, Genl. Macomb, Laborie here. At the Office— Wyer— Canning— Pirates from Newfoundland. case of Milligan— Eve at Frye’s.

14. VI. Heard Little 2. Cor. 4.1.2. Paid visits to Cass— Dr. Tucker (met 2 Simmons’s from S.C. Vandeventer, Captn. Smith &c) and W. H. Crawford, yet ill in his chamber— (Met D. Trimble there)— Diary— Eve at Wirt’s— Jackson, Callava and Fromentin— Pitt’s life—

15— VI— At the Office— Bresson, with three Notes from H. d. N— Yellow fever— Stackelberg— Norwegian Ships. St. Barts— Poletica’s order of St. Anne. Calhoun Case of barracks at St. Augustine— Jackson, Fromentin and Callava— Watkins here at Eve— Insurance company claims— Tazewell’s dialogues. Visit at H. d. N’s.

16. V:48. Anderson here— At the Office— Jos. Nourse, for H Nourse— Cooper of Georgia, for his father—about Slaves— Call at Calhoun’s— G. Hay here P.M. Eve at home— Letter from and to P.U.S—also from L. C. A— Race
17. VI. Calhoun here— Hughes’s and Middleton’s Letters— Canning at the Office. Newfoundland pirates— My family came home— Elizabeth in the Stage— The rest in the Evening.

18. VI. Burdick here about a Patent— Cass at the Office, with Hunt— Deaths of R. C. Norton and S. Elliot— Evening visitors H. d— N— Laborie and J. Bailey— Case of R. Purdy— W. Tennessee Marshal. George began his study of law.
19. VI. Hill, from Valparaiso, Judge Cranch, and D. Brent here— At Moulder’s upon T. Cook’s marriage to Mrs Wilson— Calhoun at the Office— Met Bomford— Sickliness— Frye’s here at Eve

20. V:30. Walk with George over Tyber, and back over the new Bridge. Packets from P.U.S— Sp. R— Called at P.U.S. after dinner— Not come G. H— at dinner— Every Man in his humour— Pitt’s Life— George’s Studies—
21. V.45— With George, heard Little. 1. John 3–2.3— Met G. Hay— Sus P.U.S. not returned— Visits from Dr. Tucker and W. Lee— Pitt’s Life.

22. V: P.U.S. returned last Night— At his house— Jeune Eugenie— Jackson, Fromentin and Callava— [symbols][Cabinet Meeting] to morrow—at 12. Calhoun there— Letters to Anduaga, and Littell and Henry— Every Man in his humour, and Pitt—

23. V. [symbols][Cabinet Meeting] at P.U.S. present— Calhoun and Wirt— Florida— Brown Jackson—discussion upon military powers— [symbols][P.U.S.] Power over Militia talk with Gaines— [symbols] Stipulation for Spaniards only— Calhoun— Jackson’s opinion deliberate—mine alone with him— Question postponed— Fromentin. Read his Letter—of 6 [symbols][September]—adjourned— Watkins Anonymous letter to P.U.S. threatened pamphlet— Watkins here at eve— [symbols] dined at T. Cook’s. [symbols]— Byron.

24. V:15. [symbols][Cabinet Meeting]— Calhoun & Wirt— (Seaton)— Jackson and Spanish Officers. Fromentin’s jurisdiction limited— Jackson’s right to summon him discussed— Calhoun & Wirt, immunities of a judge—mine coram non judice necessity of deciding the military question— Wirt unwell—adjourned. Dined at S. Canning’s— 23. Byron— Life of Pitt—despatch from Middleton. Bray.

25. V:15. [symbols][Cabinet Meeting]— Calhoun & Wirt— Jackson’s right to banish discussed— Wirt’s questions—was Callava an Officer— His immunities as Commr— Vattel— I am to write to Salmon— Jackson & Fromentin— Eve and Supper at Frye’s— Chess.

26. VI:45. Mrs Adams ill in bed— A. Scott at the Office— And P.U.S. Notes from him— Drafts to Fromentin and Jackson— One to Salmon begun. Letter to Walsh—one from Shaw— Vote of Suffolk bar. Dr Thornton and the renovator, penholder—

27. V: At the Office W. Coxe for R. M. Harrison— Wyer, convalescent. E. Dorr, from Boston—his 2. daughters. Watkins—Commrs. Accts $3989. at P.U.S—walking with Calhoun— His doubts of Callava’s privileges. Pitt’s Life—Evening walk— Draft to Anduaga—
28. V. Heard Little— Isaiah 45.22–25— Visitors— I did not see them. Note from P.U.S— Walk after dinner— Fire. Dr Thornton here— Note from P.U.S. Drafts.

29. V: Anduaga and Salmon at the Office— Call on P.U.S— Crawford there— Light House keepers— Drafts—to Anduaga— Jackson— Fromentin. P.U.S. Amendments discussed—proposal acknowledgment— Drafts left with him— Jeune Eugénie, tried at Boston— Apollon— Gallatin’s Note—to be sent round— Secy. Treasys. original responsibility— P.U.S—absent then. Lane— Stackelberg’s Card and Treaty— Walk. T. Monroe jr & Watkins with queries— His opn. of W. K.
31. VI:15. Rainy day— Presented Anduaga to P.U.S— despatches from Florida— Note from Caldwell and J. Law. Pitt’s Life—
